iati-activity.title: Road Maintenace and Construct.II Project
iati-activity.description: 1. Overall Objectives: The project supports the Government's transport sector objectives to improve the road network in order to develop their full socio-economic potential as well as to ensure their political and administrative integration with the rest of the country. 2. Specific Objective: The objectives of the project are: (i) to increase transport service levels and road safety by improving road surface conditions so as to reduce vehicle operating costs and maintenance costs; (ii) to protect the investments in road infrastructure already made; (iii) to improve the organization, staff capabilities and equipment for undertaking road safety work thereby reducing deaths, injuries and property damage caused by road accidents; and (iv) to develop a stronger Malawian consulting and contracting sector which is economically independent and capable of competing with international firms.

iati-activity.title: Institutionnel Support: Aid-Debt Mgt & Governance
iati-activity.description: The ultimate aim of the project is to reduce poverty, create employment opportunities, and achieve greater economic and social development through enhancing the co-ordination, allocation and utilization of external aid. The project will also aim at promoting good governance, in the area of accountability, transparency and decentralization, which is one of t he main elements required for better utilization and more efficient allocation of donors fund. These objectives will be realized by assisting the Government in formulating a comprehensive national aid and debt policy, and strengthening the capacities of all its ministries and agencies involved in aid and debt management, i.e. MMOFEP, Reserve Bank of Malawi, National Economic Council, line ministries, DAG, NAO, Department of Districts and Local Government Administration, and representatives from the civil society. The capacity building will include training, technical assistance, information technology and other logistics.

iati-activity.title: Smallholder Outgrower Sugar-Cane Production Project
iati-activity.description: The specific objective of the project is to increase sugar-cane production by small-holder outgrower farmers around Dwangwa through better access to irrigation, advisory services and other physical inputs. The proposed project will increase hectarage under irrigation to 2,140 ha by PY5. Furthermore, average net rainfed per ha farm income for sugarcane outgrowers will increase from current UA628 to at least UA2900 from PY2 because of irrigation.

iati-activity.title: Kamuzu Inter. Airport Phase 3 (ADB)
iati-activity.description: Le projet vise à permettre au Malawi, pays sans littoral, de bénéficier de l'atout vital que constitue un aéroport parfaitement équipé pour assurer des services internationaux de transport de voyageurs et de marchandises reliant la nouvelle capitale, Lilongwe, au reste du monde. Il permettra aussi au pays de tirer au maximun parti des investissements qui lui ont déjà consentis en faveur de l'aménagement de l'aéroport international de Kamuzu, en finançant la construction d'ouvrages auxiliaires indispensables.

iati-activity.description: It will consist of the following pricipal component: (i) The modification of existing intake and the expansion of raw water intake treatment plant and clear water pumps, as well as the construction of a balancing tank and the provison of surge protection equipment at Walker's Ferry. ii) The construction of a new booster station between Walker's Ferry and Chileka and the provision and ecpansion of pumping plants for the new station and for Chileka as well as the construction of balancing tanks. iii) Addition of about 8,000 ft. 27 ins. in diameter and about 7,000 ft. 24 ins. in diameter mains parallel to the existing treated water mains. (iv) Expansion and improvement of the distribution and transmission system by the construction of eight service reservoirs, three break pressure tanks and expansion of distribution pumping stations as well as laying of 182,000 ft. mains ranging in size from 6 ins. (150 mm) to 24 ins. (600 mm) in diameter. (v) Extension of Mudi pumps and pumping station. iati-activity.title: Agricultural Sector Adjustment Loan
iati-activity.description: The primary objectives of the programme are to achieve sustainable growth and to reduce poverty and food insecurity. To achieve these objectives, the programme will continue and expand ongoing reforms to maintain appropriate macroeconomic policies as well as agricultural policy reforms to ensure adequate producer incentives and efficient marketing services for smallholders. The programme also aims at improving ADMARC's capability to carry out the functions of a price stabilization agency. To this end further measures will be initiated to (a) improve efficiency in agricultural public expenditures by reviewing and restructuring them to ensure consistency with sector priorities and cost-effectiveness; (b) implement pilot schemes to develop ways of targeting fertilizer subsides and credit to the poor; and (c) strengthen the Government's capacity to monitor and redress the impact of the adjustment programme on the poor.

iati-activity.title: Industrial Sector Opportunities Study
iati-activity.description: The main objectives of the proposed study are to: (i) identify and assess opportunities in the industrial sector which are critical for development and/or in which Malawi has either global or regio- nal comparative advantage; (ii) identify and study constraints barring industrial development; (iii) study and recommend measures needed to stimulate industrial production; (iv) estimate the requi- red financial and other resources for implementing the identified opportunities and (v) study the possibilities of expanding and starting new export-oriented industries in Malawi, especially through manufacturing under bond operations and export processing zones. In order to attain these objectives the ISOP study will con- centrate on the following major areas: - resource base for industrial development includint human, energy, agricultural, mining and technical resources; - domestic, regional and overseas markets, with special emphasis on backward and forward linkages; - policy framework, institutional setting and incentive; - investment and other resource requirement; - appropriate arrangements for Malawi to attract investment for export-oriented production. - physical constraints on further industrial development inclu- ding transport, energy, telecommunications and other supporting infrastructures.

iati-activity.title: Malawi: Mzuzu-Nkhatabay Road Rehabilitation Project
iati-activity.description: The sector development objective is to support economic growth and to contribute to poverty reduction. Transportation costs are believed to constitute up to 56% of the cost of some goods in Malawi (ICSP, 2011-2012). To reduce transportation costs, Malawi requires an efficient, safe and affordable transportation network to connect to productive areas within-country and to regional transport corridors. Rehabilitation of the proposed road shall contribute to the Transport Sector Investment Programme being pursued by the GoM in order to support economic activities. Specific objectives of the project are: (i) to rehabilitate the Mzuzu-Nkhata Bay Road (46km) and improve the road from poor condition to good condition; (ii) reduce travel time between the towns of Mzuzu and Nkhata Bay; (iii) improve safety features of the road for both motorized and non-motorized traffic including pedestrians along the road; and (iv) provide access to social-economic centers. The rehabilitation of the road shall also provide temporary employment to households living within the project area.

iati-activity.title: Governance and Poverty Reduction Support Grant II (Gprsg II)
iati-activity.description: The broad goal of the GPRSG II is to reduce poverty as laid out in Malawi's MGDS. More specifically, the program's objective is to enhance the efficiency, transparency and accountability in the use of public resources (improve financial governance) while helping increase public service delivery. To that end it builds upon the Government's reform program as defined in the Government's Letter of Development Policy, which lays out the Government's challenge of stimulating the implementation of its recently redesigned Public Financial and Economic Management (PFEM) Prioritised Action Plan (PAP). By improving financial governance through greater efficiency, transparency, and accountability in the use of public resources, the GPRSG II seeks to make the budgeting process more efficient and enable both more and better provision of social services, especially to the poor.

iati-activity.title: Poverty Reduction Support Loan
iati-activity.description: In the medium-term through the MGDS, the Government aims to reduce poverty headcount from 52.4% to 44.4% between 2006 and 2011. It will promote strong and sustainable economic growth, building a healthy and educated human resource base, and protecting and empowering the vulnerable. It envisages carrying out the necessary reforms for the economy to grow at a minimum rate of 6% in the next 5 years through investment, promotion and providing the requisite policy and institutional framework to promote agriculture and food security, infrastructure development, generation of energy and supply, irrigation and water development and integrated rural development. The ADF's proposed loan will deepen the Bank Group's support for the Government reform agenda by: (i) ensuring sound macroeconomic management whilst strengthening public financial management; (ii) increasing access to education and health services whilst training front line service providers, and; (iii) increasing the effectiveness of the justice system and reducing corruption. In this, the PRSL will help implement the MGDS.

iati-activity.title: Feas. Study for District Water Supply II
iati-activity.description: The consultant will be required to: 1) Make comprehensive assessment of the present and future demands by taking into consideration of such factors as the present population, public, institutional, commercial and industrial water users and making projections of the same. ii) Make a thorough study of the existing water supply and evaluate their reliability to the present and projected District Centres requirements. iii) Study the available water resources and formulate a long-term master plan of the development of the water supplies to all the said rural growth centres up to the year 2005, followed by preparation of a phased priority programme of the necessary works to satisfy demand in then year stages. iv) Prepare an overall implementation programme of the centres' water supply and carry out engineering design of the projects initial stage, make economic and financial analysis with an aim of arriving at a clearly defined project which would require minimum further preparation before implementation.
